result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyaries O Mckinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyaries O Mckinney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 7/14/2016 "JOC shall be amended by reflecting two years of Extended Supervision".
Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. jbs
Partial sentencing hearing transcript from May 6, 2016, received and filed.
Partial bail refund check packet
Letter from DOC (Probation Dept.) seeking clarification of bifurcated sentence.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve maximum term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. In the Wisconsin State Prison System.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days condition time at the House of Corrections with Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 05-13-2016.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- No weapons or firearms 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Attorney Bowe informed the Clerk and Court that she told her client to appear at 1:30pm today when the hearing was actually at 8:30am.  The ADA is not available this afternoon.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned for sentencing to May 6, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe (who appeared earlier).  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared (via telephone) for Megan Marie Williamson for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Attorney Bowe is in another court and unavailable and requested an adjournment.  No objection from the State.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned for sentencing to March 30, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Trish I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Matter set for sentencing on March 3, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter remains in trial posture. Final pretrial motions must be filed 30 days prior to trial date. Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/30/15 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8.19.15 and for jury trial on 9.30.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case 00CF3026 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state: James Henner, Detective-MPD   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Tyaries O Mckinney in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
